result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas James House was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain a HSED during the pendency of probation term.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Contact with J. T. M (as named in the complaint) at the discretion of the supervising agent.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

3:00 pm cases called-15CM442, 15TR2990, 16CF125, 16CM74, 16CM81, 16TR235, 16TR236, 16TR475, 16TR476, 16TR477, 16TR1772, 16TR1773, 16TR1774, 16TR1775, 16TR1776, 16TR1777, 16TR1778, 16TR1779, 16TR1780, 16TR1781, 16TR1782, 16TR1783, & 16TR1784. Defendant Thomas James House in court with attorney Amanda M. Belville.  Defendant Thomas James House in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record by DA Blader.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 of 15CM442, No Contest to Count 1 of 16CM74, No Contest to Count 1 of 16CM81, No Contest to Count 1 of 16CF125, and No Contest to 16TR1778. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads in: Counts 2, 3, 4 of 16CM74, Count 2 of 16CM81, Counts 2, 3, 4, & 5 of 16CF125, 15TR2990, 16TR235, 16TR236, 16TR475, 16TR476, 16TR477, 16TR1772, 16TR1773, 16TR1774, 16TR1775, 16TR1776, 16TR1777, 16TR1779, 16TR1780, 16TR1781, 16TR1782, 16TR1783, & 16TR1784. Statement by victim in 16CM81. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Belville. Statement by defendant. Statement by Court prior to sentence. Court sentences the defendant to: 
16CF125-SWD and places on probation for a period of 3 years. CONDITIONS: 150 days WCJ, with Huber-No Good Time credit. Credit of 33 days served. To begin immediately. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through, Absolute Sobriety, No bars, No impairing substance w/o Rx, Defendant to obtain HSED. Terms of Agent, Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Court grants expungment upon successful completion of probation. Contact with J. T. M. (as named in the complaint) at the discretion of the supervising agent. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.
16CM74- SWD and places on probation for a period of 2 years. CONDITIONS: 10 days WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Concurrent to 16CF125. $1,492.00 fine inclusive of costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 13 months drivers license revocation, 13 month IID, OWI Assessment. AODA and follow through, Absolute sobriety, No bars, and no Rx w/o Rx. Contact with J. T. M. (as named in the complaint) at the discretion of the supervising agent. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.
16CM81-SWD and places on probation for a period of 2 years. CONDITIONS: 29 days WCJ, with Huber. Consecutive to 16CF125. AODA and follow through, Absolute Sobriety, No bars, No Rx w/o Rx. Contact with J. T. M. (as named in the complaint) at the discretion of the supervising agent.  Terms of Agent, Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. 
15CM442-SWD and places on probation for a period of 2 years. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through, Absolute Sobriety, No bars, No Rx w/o Rx. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Contact with J. T. M. (as named in the complaint) at the discretion of the supervising agent. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given. 
16TR1778-Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.

Case Called @ 10:30 AM:  Defendant Thomas James House in court with attorney Amanda Belville.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Def requests Atty Belville be appointed on the other pending cases - he was found not eligible for SPD services as to the new matter. Court will appoint Atty Belville on the new pending matters and he understands that he will be responsible for her Attorney Fees incurred.  Atty Belville requests IA be set aside. Court suggests Attorney Authorization for future Court appearances due to Def's newly acquired employment.  Court will require that the $250 deposit be paid by the end of the week - no later than 3/11/2016.  Off Record for Def to speak with counsel.  Back of Record @ 11:07 AM:  Appearances restated by the Court.  Court confirms discussions regarding ineligibility for SPD services due to employment and agrees to Court Appointment of Atty Belville.  Court will require that no later than 3/11/2016 a deposit of $250 must be paid.  Commencing 5/1/2016, $100 payment plan per month.  Appointment will be as to all 3 cases.  16CM-81:   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP received and entered as to both charges.   ADA argues as to new bond of $2500 Signature Bond w/conditions.  No objection to bond request.  Court orders $2500 Signature Bond w/conditions.  STC Scheduled as to all matters- NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
